page.title: 11FARMING IN LOWER PENARTH.
page.content: The above brick and slate_roofed farm_ house,built at Lower Cosmeston in 1910 by the{Marquis of Bute,replaced the original house circa 1750,which is now used for fodder storage and livestock housing.Nearby,there is a mixture of traditional and modern multi_purpose farm buildings grouped around two farm yards.Economic and political factors have brought about changes in the farming patterns with the traditional methods of necessity giving way to the {modern}methods.Former dairy buildings have been adapted to accommodate a beef and sheep enterprise.Livestock comprises,150{Hereford Cross beef cattle and a flock of 250 sheep, which includes 160{Beulah breeding}ewes.Also kept are domestic fowls and a working sheep/cattle dog.Machinery includes 2 tractors and a wide range of necessary equipment and tools.
